guidelines.title: Safety
guidelines.content: When people install an app from the App Store, they want to feel confident that it's safe to do so.

subsections.title: Objectionable Content
subsections.content: Apps should not include content that is offensive, insensitive, upsetting, intended to disgust, in exceptionally poor taste, or just plain creepy.
common_violations: User-generated content without moderation
Realistic violence or gore
Content that targets a specific group

subsections.title: Defamatory, discriminatory, or mean-spirited content
subsections.content: No content targeting religion, race, sexual orientation, gender, national/ethnic origin, or other groups.

subsections.title: Realistic portrayals of violence
subsections.content: No realistic portrayals of people or animals being killed, maimed, tortured, or abused.

subsections.title: Content encouraging illegal activities
subsections.content: Depictions that encourage illegal or reckless use of weapons and dangerous objects.

subsections.title: Overtly sexual or pornographic material
subsections.content: Explicit descriptions or displays of sexual organs or activities.

subsections.title: Religious commentary
subsections.content: No controversial or inaccurate references to religious texts.

subsections.title: False information and features
subsections.content: Apps with false info or features that are not accurately represented.

subsections.title: App Store Reviews manipulation
subsections.content: No attempting to manipulate reviews through incentivized reviews, fake reviews, etc.

subsections.title: User-Generated Content
subsections.content: Apps with user-generated content present particular challenges. Apps with UGC must have filtering, reporting, blocking, and content moderation.
common_violations: Missing content reporting mechanism
No ability to block abusive users
Inadequate content moderation
No method for users to flag inappropriate content
Missing contact info for reporting concerns

subsections.title: Kids Category
subsections.content: Apps in the Kids Category must not include links out of the app, purchasing opportunities, or other content inappropriate for kids. Must comply with COPPA and GDPR-K.
common_violations: Third-party analytics SDKs collecting data from minors
External links or web views without parental gates
Ads not appropriate for children
Missing parental gate before external links or purchases
Using analytics/tracking SDKs that collect child data

subsections.title: Physical Harm
subsections.content: Apps should not encourage illegal or excessive consumption of drugs/alcohol, or encourage minors to consume such substances.
common_violations: Medical apps providing dangerous advice without disclaimers
Apps encouraging substance abuse
Drug dosage calculators without medical professional oversight
Apps facilitating purchase of controlled substances

subsections.title: Developer Information
subsections.content: People need to know how to reach you with questions and support issues. Provide a working support URL and contact info.
common_violations: Missing or broken support URL
No contact information
Fake developer information

subsections.title: Data Security
subsections.content: Apps should implement appropriate security measures to ensure proper handling of user information.
common_violations: Transmitting sensitive data without encryption (HTTP instead of HTTPS)
Storing passwords in plain text
Missing SSL/TLS for API communications

guidelines.title: Performance
guidelines.content: Your app should be complete, reliable, and ready for prime time.

subsections.title: App Completeness
subsections.content: Submissions must be final versions. Apps that crash, have broken links, placeholder content, or are clearly not finished will be rejected.
common_violations: App crashes on launch or during core flows
Placeholder text or images (Lorem ipsum, etc.)
Broken links or features
Incomplete onboarding flows
Features that don't work as described
'Coming soon' or 'under construction' sections
console.log/print statements left in production code
Debug menus or developer tools accessible to users

subsections.title: Beta Testing
subsections.content: Demos, betas, and trial versions don't belong on the App Store. Use TestFlight instead.
common_violations: App labeled as 'beta' or 'preview'
Time-limited functionality
References to TestFlight or beta programs in UI

subsections.title: Accurate Metadata
subsections.content: Customers should know what they're getting when they download your app. Description, screenshots, and previews must accurately reflect the app.
common_violations: Screenshots that don't match actual app UI
Description promises features that don't exist
Wrong category selected
Hidden features not described in metadata
References to other mobile platforms (Android, Google Play, etc.)
Mentioning competing platforms in keywords or description
Misleading app previews

subsections.title: Hardware Compatibility
subsections.content: Apps should work on all supported devices without crashes or compatibility issues.
common_violations: App doesn't work on older supported devices
Missing iPad support when marked as universal
Crashes on specific screen sizes
Hardcoded device dimensions instead of responsive layout

subsections.title: Software Requirements
subsections.content: Apps must use public APIs and run on the currently shipping OS.
common_violations: Using private/undocumented APIs
Not supporting IPv6 (hardcoded IPv4 addresses)
Using deprecated APIs without fallbacks
Downloading or executing remote code
Using non-WebKit rendering engines on iOS
Background modes not justified by app functionality
Dynamic code execution (eval, dlopen)
CodePush or similar hot-patching that changes app behavior significantly

guidelines.title: Business
guidelines.content: Apps on the App Store must follow business model guidelines for payments, subscriptions, and monetization.

subsections.title: Payments
subsections.content: Apps must use Apple's in-app purchase system for digital goods and services.

subsections.title: In-App Purchase
subsections.content: Digital content, subscriptions, and unlockable features must use Apple IAP. Physical goods and services can use external payment.
common_violations: Digital goods purchased outside IAP (Stripe, PayPal for digital content)
Missing 'Restore Purchases' button
Directing users to external purchase mechanisms for digital goods
Crypto/NFT purchases not using IAP for digital goods
Links or buttons to external payment pages

subsections.title: Subscriptions
subsections.content: Auto-renewable subscriptions must clearly communicate pricing, duration, and cancellation terms.
common_violations: Unclear subscription pricing on sign-up screen
Missing free trial duration disclosure
No clear cancellation instructions
Misleading 'free' claims for subscription apps
Not disclosing auto-renewal terms

subsections.title: Reader Apps
subsections.content: Reader apps may allow users to access previously purchased content but must not include buttons or links for external purchases.
common_violations: Including 'Subscribe' buttons linking to website for digital content

subsections.title: Cryptocurrency
subsections.content: Apps may facilitate cryptocurrency transactions but must not mine cryptocurrency on device.
common_violations: On-device cryptocurrency mining
ICO/token offerings without proper compliance
Crypto wallets without proper security measures

subsections.title: Other Business Model Issues
subsections.content: Various business model requirements including acceptable monetization, advertising, and app functionality.
common_violations: Apps that are primarily marketing material
Apps with no clear business model or functionality
Misleading advertising practices
Loot boxes without odds disclosure

guidelines.title: Design
guidelines.content: Apple customers place a high value on products that are simple, refined, and easy to use.

subsections.title: Copycats
subsections.content: Don't create an app that appears confusingly similar to an existing app. Bring your own ideas.
common_violations: Cloning popular apps with minimal changes
Using another app's UI design wholesale
Confusingly similar name or icon

subsections.title: Minimum Functionality
subsections.content: Your app should include sufficient content and features that it is more than a repackaged website.
common_violations: Web view wrapper with no native features (WebView-only apps)
Single-feature apps with insufficient depth
Apps that are just a website in a frame
Apps with no meaningful native functionality

subsections.title: Spam
subsections.content: Don't create multiple apps that provide the same experience. Quality over quantity.
common_violations: Multiple nearly identical apps with different branding
Template apps with only cosmetic changes
Submitting the same app with different names

subsections.title: Extensions
subsections.content: Extensions must comply with Extension Programming Guide and additional requirements.
common_violations: Extensions that don't function independently
Keyboard extensions accessing the network unnecessarily
Safari extensions that inject ads

subsections.title: Apple Sites and Services
subsections.content: Apps must not use Apple services in unauthorized ways.
common_violations: Using Apple Maps data outside of MapKit
Scraping Apple websites or services

subsections.title: Mini Apps, Mini Games, Streaming Games, Chatbots, Plug-ins, and Game Emulators
subsections.content: Apps offering mini apps or games must ensure each one follows all App Store Review Guidelines.
common_violations: Mini apps that violate content guidelines
Emulators distributing copyrighted ROMs

subsections.title: Sign in with Apple
subsections.content: Apps that use a third-party or social login must also offer Sign in with Apple as an equivalent option.
common_violations: Offering Google/Facebook login without Sign in with Apple
Sign in with Apple placed less prominently than alternatives
Sign in with Apple missing when any social login is present

guidelines.title: Legal
guidelines.content: Apps must comply with all legal requirements in any location where they are available.

subsections.title: Privacy
subsections.content: Protecting user privacy is paramount. Apps must comply with Apple's privacy guidelines.

subsections.title: Data Collection and Storage
subsections.content: Apps must have a privacy policy and clearly describe what data they collect and how it's used.
common_violations: No privacy policy or privacy policy URL
Collecting data not disclosed in privacy nutrition labels
Missing PrivacyInfo.xcprivacy manifest
Missing or vague purpose strings for camera, location, microphone, etc.
Collecting data without user consent
Third-party SDKs collecting undisclosed data
Requesting 'Always' location when 'WhenInUse' suffices
Missing App Tracking Transparency (ATT) prompt when using ad/tracking SDKs

subsections.title: Data Use and Sharing
subsections.content: Data collected must not be shared or sold without user knowledge and consent.
common_violations: Sharing user data with third parties without disclosure
Using collected data for purposes not described
Tracking users without ATT consent

subsections.title: Health and Health Research
subsections.content: Health-related apps must not store health data in iCloud and must use HealthKit APIs properly.
common_violations: Storing health data insecurely
Using HealthKit data for advertising
Health apps without medical disclaimers

subsections.title: Kids
subsections.content: Apps in the Kids category must not transmit information about a child to third parties.
common_violations: Analytics SDKs tracking minors
Ad SDKs in kids apps
Collecting personal data from children without parental consent

subsections.title: Location Services
subsections.content: Use location only when directly relevant to the app's features.
common_violations: Requesting always-on location without justification
Using location for advertising without consent
Background location without clear user benefit

subsections.title: Intellectual Property
subsections.content: Make sure your app only includes content you created or have a license to use.
common_violations: Using copyrighted images, music, or video
Trademark infringement in app name or icon
Including content from other apps without permission

subsections.title: Gaming, Gambling, and Lotteries
subsections.content: Gambling apps must be geo-restricted and provide proper age gates.
common_violations: Simulated gambling without age restrictions
Real-money gambling without proper licensing
Missing geo-restriction for regulated gambling

subsections.title: VPN Apps
subsections.content: VPN apps must use the NEVPNManager API and may not sell or share user data.
common_violations: VPN apps not using NEVPNManager API
VPN apps logging/selling user traffic data

subsections.title: Mobile Device Management
subsections.content: MDM apps must only be offered by commercial enterprises and must not be required by non-enterprise apps.
common_violations: Consumer apps requiring MDM enrollment
MDM apps collecting unnecessary data
